DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/access/app.description: Deletes an Access policy specific to an application. To delete a reusable policy, use the /accounts/{account_id}/policies/{uid} endpoint.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

id.description: UUID

202.description: Delete an Access application policy response.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Delete an Access application policy response failure.

GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/apps/{.description: Lists Access policies configured for an application. Returns both exclusively scoped and reusable policies used by the application.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

POST /accounts/{account_id}/access/apps/.description: Creates a policy applying exclusive to a single application that defines the users or groups who can reach it. We recommend creating a reusable policy instead and subsequently referencing its ID in the application's 'policies' array.

isolation_required.description: Require this application to be served in an isolated browser for users matching this policy. 'Client Web Isolation' must be on for the account in order to use this feature.

name.description: The name of the Access policy.

purpose_justification_prompt.description: A custom message that will appear on the purpose justification screen.
purpose_justification_prompt.example: Please enter a justification for entering this protected domain.

purpose_justification_required.description: Require users to enter a justification when they log in to the application.

require.description: Rules evaluated with an AND logical operator. To match the policy, a user must meet all of the Require rules.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for the application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or s), ms, s, m, h.

precedence.description: The order of execution for this policy. Must be unique for each policy within an app.

200.description: Update an Access application policy response.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Update an Access application policy response failure.
